fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Consumers, Customs, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
Main EU initiatives, policies and legislative files currently followed by your organisation:  
Ford of Europe follows a range of EU initiatives relating to industrial, competitiveness, trade, environmental and safety policy. 
 
Current legislative files include: 
CO2 post-2020 framework 
Worldwide Harmonized Light vehicles Test Procedures (WLTP) / Real Driving Emissions (RDE) / Air Quality 
Trade Policy 
White Paper on Transport 
Connectivity
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Working Group on Motor Vehicles#E01295#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1295#Not a member#C#Real Driving Emissions - Light Duty Vehicles#Evaporative Emissions
goals__remit: Ford Motor Company, a global automotive industry leader based in Dearborn, Mich., manufactures or distributes automobiles across six continents. With about 164,000 employees and about 70 plants worldwide, the company’s automotive brands include Ford and Lincoln. The company provides financial services through Ford Motor Credit Company.
relevant_communication: Ford of Europe engages in policy discussions via face-to-face meetings, public consultation, briefing papers and industry-wide events.
